content:
Hello everyone!

I know it's possible to view the HIR of a piece of source code with:

cargo rustc -- -Zunpretty=hir-tree

And you can view the generated MIR, LLVM IR, and Assembly code on Rust Playground.

Is there any way to view the AST that is generated by the compiler for a piece of source code before it is lowered to the HIR?
I wonder if we should do something using e.g. serde or even a more specialized derive, that is focused on being nice rather than just a raw dump
